t_hieroglyph_recognition.quote: The T Hieroglyph as Wax, not Bread. It is shaped like the Headcones, and is used all over the place, it is Saponified beeswax
t_hieroglyph_recognition.significance: Revolutionary reinterpretation of Egyptian writing system revealing consciousness technology

biblical_preservation.quote: As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the Lord commanded the blessing, even life for evermore

recognition.quote: Here are some that are a little Melted on, once You understand whats going on its obvious. And this is part of some kind of Initiation Ritual, and the Summer Feast that was in August
recognition.function: Not metaphorical dew but actual wax headcone consciousness technology - melting substance flowing down from elevated position providing life forevermore = consciousness awakening

egyptian_sacred_use.quote: Beeswax was believed to be a powerful agent, both protective and destructive. It was malleable and easily burned, and thus thought to possess the ability to inflict harm or change on another

consciousness_interface_properties.quote: Priests burned beeswax candles in temples as offerings to the gods, believing the light and purity of beeswax carried spiritual meaning

lost_wax_casting.quote: A famous example is the lost-wax casting technique. This method used beeswax to create molds for intricate bronze sculptures... This method is still used today, proving how enduring the technique has been
lost_wax_casting.significance: Same material serving BOTH metallurgical AND spiritual consciousness applications - exactly as found at Mount Hermon sites

section_4_carthaginian_innovation.title: Carthaginian Innovation - Punic Wax Defined

pliny_documentation.quote: Pliny distinguishes two older methods (Naturalis Historia, 35, 41) and one invented by Carthaginians for ships, the so-called Punic wax. The first two methods consist in applying the hot wax in its molten state... The third method requires the application of the cold wax as a saponified emulsion

archaeological_confirmation.quote: Particularly significant were the varied compositions of residues from four sections of a multi-compartment container. In one of these compartments, the beeswax seems to have been prepared as the Punic wax described by Pliny

section_4_carthaginian_innovation.carthaginian_specific: Cold-application saponified emulsion - consciousness technology that could be transported, stored, and applied without heat - revolutionary advancement

all_methods.egyptian_headcone: Pure beeswax + aromatics, melted on head
all_methods.pliny_seawater: Prepared by boiling the yellow wax in seawater mixed with a little nitrum and exposing it to the sun
all_methods.potash_method: Beeswax + Potash lye water, pour and stir repeatedly
all_methods.german_patent: Bleached wax saponified with potash for water-solubility

fritz_faiss_rediscovery.method: One covered a method for treating beeswax so that its melting point was raised from 60 degrees Celsius to 100 degrees Celsius (from 140 to 212 F). This occurred after boiling the wax in a solution of sea water and soda three successive times
